Description.En:
• Skills to be Gained: Master the TRIZ methodology through the FINDER platform, learn how to utilize cutting-edge AI technologies (GPT-4, deep learning, GANs, NLP), and develop advanced problem-solving techniques.

• AI’s Impact on the Targeted Field: Gain insights into how AI and LLMs enhance innovation processes and streamline the creation of groundbreaking solutions in industrial settings.

• Practical Application of Theoretical Knowledge: You will work hands-on with FINDER to tackle real-world challenges, applying TRIZ and AI technologies such as GPT-4 and GANs to generate actionable, industry-ready solutions.

• Interdisciplinary and International Collaboration: FINDER facilitates global teamwork and cross-sector cooperation, enabling participants to collaborate remotely with peers and industry experts.

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of this challenge, you will be able to use a variety of digital tools for collaboration, content creation, and problem-solving. You will also use digital tools to advise on patents.
By the end of this challenge, you will be able to analyse a range of issues by using a variety of different methodologies and approaches.
By the end of this challenge, you will be able to think creativley and innovatively, as well as develop creative ideas.
By the end of this challenge, you will be able to present your arguments persuasively to a range of stakeholders, as well as participating in active discussions.

LegalName.En: INSTITUT NATIONAL DES SCIENCES APPLIQUEES DE TOULOUSE (INSA TOULOUSE)

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**Teaching Method:** Hybrid format combining online sessions and in-person workshops, with practical collaborative work on the FINDER platform. Workshops on using GPT-4 APIs and other advanced AI technologies will be included.

**Study Period:**

- Session 1 : online theoritical introductory session with all the students : Week of February 3  
- Session 2 : online practical introductuory session : beginning of March  
- Session 3 : online practical case study workshop : beginning of April  
- In-person or online workshop : From June 2nd to June 6th 2025

**Workload** (percentage): 25% to 50%, incorporating online work on FINDER, AI workshops, and interactions with industry professionals.

**Deliverables:** Industry-ready solutions developed using TRIZ and AI through the FINDER platform, including virtual prototypes or visual sketches applicable to specific industrial challenges. All delivered in a short video as a final evaluation file of between 3 to 5 minutes long.

In this industrial challenge, students, organized into multidisciplinary groups of 3 to 4, will be guided through a comprehensive problem-solving process provided by an industry partner. Conducted on the FINDER platform, the project begins with a literature review and technological watch phase, enabling participants to understand the topic thoroughly and identify key challenges. Following this, they will define specific problems and underlying challenges, using the TRIZ methodology to structure their thinking and foster inventive idea generation. Students will also have opportunities to present their progress at defined milestones, progressively working towards the creation of a conceptual solution that meets the identified needs. The final exam will be a live presentation in front of Industrials from ArcelorMittal company our Challenge provider this year.
Unlock Advanced Problem-Solving at the Intersection of TRIZ, AI, and Industrial Revolution

This challenge explores how the TRIZ methodology, supercharged by Artificial Intelligence (AI), can be leveraged to accelerate industrial innovation. Utilizing the FINDER platform (Framework for Inventive Design Research), a collaborative online environment specifically designed for this purpose, participants will engage with cutting-edge AI technologies, such as GPT-4 APIs, deep learning, GANs, and Natural Language Processing (NLP). Backed by an internationally renowned industrial partner and part of the AIARD (Artificial Intelligence Assisted Research & Development) initiative, this challenge offers a unique opportunity to solve real-world industrial problems using next-generation tools.

• Target Audience: Students from engineering, AI, innovation management, and industrial solution development backgrounds.

• Admission Criteria: Basic skills in AI, deep learning, and innovation; prior experience in technology or industrial projects is preferred.

• Background: Open to all ECIU candidates with STEM, AI, or innovation-related backgrounds.

• Steps to Apply: Online application submission, including CV, cover letter.

• Required Documents: CV, motivation letter, transcript of records.
